posts.title: Finalists and winning solution to the #StatsDay15 Data Visualization Challenge
posts.text:
On World Statistics Day 2015, the [United Nations Statistics Division]( http://unstats.un.org/ ) and [Unite Ideas]( https://unite.un.org/ideas/closed/400) are proud to announce the finalists and winning solution to the #StatsDay15 Data Visualization Challenge competition.

We invite you to [browse the gallery](https://worldstatisticsday.org/data-visualisation-challenge.html) and explore the winning solution, submitted by Jeremy Boy from France, as well as other five finalist solutions.

We are delighted by the quality and the creativity of all the submissions by talented participants from all around the World, all of which provide valuable insights into relevant development policy question based on the indicators of the [MDG database]( http://mdgs.un.org/unsd/mdg/Metadata.aspx).

posts.title: Malta celebrates with a seminar on “Better data. Better lives.”
posts.text:
On 20 October the [National Statistics Office] (http://nso.gov.mt) of Malta held a seminar to celebrate World Statistics Day, with the theme “Better Data, Better Lives”. The objective of the seminar was to increase awareness and recognition of the role of statistics in shaping policy making in many areas, with the aim of making effective impacts on societies and lives. The topics presented span the economic and social spectrum. The audience included key stakeholders and users, opinion makers, the media and NSO staff members.

 For more details please see [here](http://nso.gov.mt/en/nso/WSD2015/Pages/World-Statistics-Day-2015.aspx).

posts.title: Costa Rica’s National Institute of Statistics and Census celebrations of World Statistics Day 2015
posts.text:

posts.title: The World’s Women 2015 Trends and Statistics
posts.text:
The World’s Women 2015 Trends and Statistics is now available @ [http://unstats.un.org/unsd/gender/worldswomen.html](http://unstats.un.org/unsd/gender/worldswomen.html) The report presents the latest statistics and analysis on the status of women and men in the world, highlighting the current situation and changes over time. The report is the sixth in the series which has been published every five years by the UN Statistics Division, as called for in the Beijing Platform for Action adopted at the Fourth World Conference on Women in 1995.

 The World’s Women 2015 highlights that progress towards the goal of gender equality has been made in the last two decades in most areas of concern, although at low and uneven pace. Through a life cycle approach, the publication reveals the challenges and specific needs experienced by women during their different stages of life. The different trajectories of women and men--from childhood through the working and reproductive stage to older age--are highlighted in the analysis undertaken in eight chapters of the report, each representing a broad area of concern: population and families, health, education, work, power and decision-making, violence against women, environment and poverty. A wide selection of statistics and indicators covered in the publication are presented in its Statistical Annex, available online @ [http://unstats.un.org/unsd/gender/worldswomen.html](http://unstats.un.org/unsd/gender/worldswomen.html)

posts.text:

In their [press release] (http://media.unwto.org/press-release/2015-10-20/world-statistics-day-unwto-calls-more-and-better-tourism-data).

 “Robust tourism statistics are vital to guide sustainable development, monitor progress, evaluate impact, promote results-focused management, and highlight strategic issues for policy objectives. UNWTO calls upon national governments to work towards building internationally comparable and reliable tourism statistics, including Tourism Satellite Accounts (TSA), in line with the UN approved guiding namely the International Recommendations, the International Recommendations for Tourism Statistics 2008 and the Tourism Satellite Account: Recommended Methodological Framework 2008” said UNWTO Secretary-General, Taleb Rifai.

Results will be announced by next year.

posts.title: Former U.S. Labor Statistics Commissioners Carroll D. Wright and Janet L. Norwood were inducted into Labor Hall of Honor on World Statistics Day
posts.text:
On World Statistics Day, 20 October 2015, [Carroll D. Wright] (http://www.bls.gov/bls/history/commissioners/wright.htm), the first commissioner of the “Bureau of Labor,” and [Janet L. Norwood] (http://www.bls.gov/bls/history/commissioners/norwood.htm), the Bureau of Labor Statistics’ first female commissioner, were inducted into the [Labor Department’s Hall of Honor](http://www.dol.gov/dol/aboutdol/hallofhonor/).

 Carroll Wright was the first [Bureau of Labour (BLS)] (http://www.bls.gov/home.htm) Commissioner, serving from 1885 to 1905. Janet Norwood was the first woman to serve as BLS Commissioner and led the Bureau for 12 crucial years (1979-1991), modernizing it and raising the profile of its work. Both former Commissioners ensured BLS produced the high quality of statistics necessary to the proper functioning of a democratic government. This was the first time BLS Commissioners were inducted into the Labor Hall of Honor. The Hall of Honor was established in 1988 to honor those Americans whose distinctive contributions in the field of labor have elevated working conditions, wages, and over-all quality of life of America’s working families.

 The full ceremony can be watched here: 

 [![Bureau of Labour (BLS)](img/posts/US_CensusBureau_video.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wouyNVtTMkI)

posts.title: Celebration of the World Statistics Day in Lithuania
posts.text:
On 20 October 2015, Lithuania, together with many other countries of the world, celebrated the World Statistics Day.

 A conference dedicated to the World Statistics Day took place in the Government Office. It was attended by the representatives of the Government, institutions producing official statistics and providing administrative data for statistical purposes, members of the Statistical Council and the [Lithuanian Statistical Society] (http://www.statistikusajunga.lt], representatives of the media, academic community, employees of [Statistics Lithuania] (http://www.stat.gov.lt/) and other members of the national statistical community.

 The Director General of Statistics Lithuania Vilija Lapėnienė emphasised that statistical quality requires several preconditions: first, accurate primary statistical data provided by respondents (enterprises, individuals, administrative sources – State registers); second, well-educated and professional staff, able to apply advanced and reliable statistical methods; and, third, professional independence of statistical authorities. “Do all those three preconditions exist in Lithuania? In one word – yes”, – affirmed Vilija Lapėnienė.

 At the conference, speeches were also given by the representatives of the main official statistics user groups – advisor to the SEB Bank [http://sebgroup.com] president, financial analyst Gitanas Nausėda, deputy editor-in-chief of a daily [Verslo žinios] (vz.lt) (Business News) Irma Verbienė. At the end of the celebration, a family of musicians – Raminta, Augustas and Benas Gocentas – performed musical compositions.

 For more information see and photos [see here] (http://www.stat.gov.lt/en/home/-/asset_publisher/lbrXvLVHX2ln/content/minejome-pasauline-statistikos-diena?redirect=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.stat.gov.lt%2Fen%2Fhome%3Fp_p_id%3D101_INSTANCE_lbrXvLVHX2ln%26p_p_lifecycle%3D0%26p_p_state%3Dnormal%26p_p_mode%3Dview%26p_p_col_id%3Dcolumn-3%26p_p_col_count%3D1).

posts.title: UNESCO supports World Statistics Day
posts.text: The Director-General of the [United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)](http://www.unesco.org), Irina Bokova, issued a message on the occasion of World Statistics Day in which she emphasized that “the demand for internationally comparable data is reaching new heights with the adoption of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)”. She also stressed that “statistics is never a matter of simply 'gathering' pre-existing data: it is a construct that plays a part in creating the reality that it reveals. It brings to light previously unnoticed inequalities, fostering social awareness and helping us to find our bearings in terms of how we look at the world. Through the strength of a number or a well-illustrated graphic, statistics are worth more than a lengthy speech. They are a public good that every citizen must be able to understand and every State must be able to make the most of, to the advantage of all.” The full statement is available [here] (http://en.unesco.org/news/world-statistics-day-2015).

posts.title: United States Naval Academy Economics Department Midshipmen celebrated World Statistics Day
posts.text:
Students of the [Economics Department] (http://www.usna.edu/EconDept/) Midshipmen at the [US Naval Academy] (http://www.usna.edu) marked World Statistics Day by discussing how economic policy is hardwired into economic data. Students also discussed how statistics affect their professional and personal lives, including the impact of weather and tidal predictions on navigation and logistics and the impact of the internet data on how they get and use data in their planning, shopping, and travel decisions. They also discussed an article from the [Guardian] (http://www.theguardian.com/news/datablog/2015/oct/20/why-world-statistics-day-is-something-worth-celebrating?CMP=share_btn_link) on World Statistics Day which raised the issue of the uses and misuses of statistics in public policy and politics.

posts.title: Two World Statistics Day special editions
posts.text:

In his introduction, John Pullinger, the UK National Statistician and current chair of the UN Statistical Commission emphaisized that the theme of this year's World Statistics Day was “vitally important for the work of the statistical community worldwide”. The eleven articles show “merely a glimpse of the full range of problems to which statistical analysis is applied, despite touching on a wide range of issues: from economic development to trade and transport, data sharing, human rights and hunger.” For the full special see [here] (http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/j.1740-9713.2015.00854.x/abstract). A brief overview is available [here](http://www.statslife.org.uk/significance/2514).

posts.title: UN Women celebrates World Statistics Day with an “eye on the global gender gap”
posts.text:
To mark World Statistics Day, [UN Women] (http://www.unwomen.org) is showcasing new interactive figures based on the key findings in its flagship report Progress of the World’s Women 2015-2016 Transforming economies, realizing rights. These eye-catching figures visualize the progress made in the realization of women’s economic and social rights, as well as where gaps remain. They were developed to highlight the importance of gender statistics, as a foundation for informed policymaking, ultimately to secure better lives for women and girls around the world. The four interactive figures feature data on the following: global gender gaps in labour force participation; laws and policies that shape women’s access to paid work and equal conditions at work, maternity and parental leave and childcare; the poverty-reducing effects of social transfers (such as child and family benefits) for single mothers and the economic value of women’s unpaid care and domestic work.

 To view the data showcase please visit [http://progress.unwomen.org/en/2015/](http://progress.unwomen.org/en/2015/).

posts.title: This is how Papua New Guinea celebrated World Statistics Day
posts.text:
The [National Statistical Office] (http://www.nso.gov.pg) of Papua New Guinea celebrated the Day at the Kemabolo village in the Rigo District of Central Province. Media coverage from NBCPNG is available here.

 [![here](img/posts/Papua_Video.png)](https://www.youtube.com/watch/VCKVk4Lll1Q) 

The national statistician, Roko Koloma, was also on the talk-back radio show with the [UNFPA PNG Resident Represent the United Nations] (http://countryoffice.unfpa.org/png/), Walter Mendoca Filho and the Head of Economics Statistics in National Statistical Office. The three officials interacted with the public audience for two hours. Information on official statistics was also advertised in a [newspaper spread] (files/PapuaNewGuinea_newspaper.pdf).

posts.title: Cote d'Ivoire celebrated World Statistics Day
posts.text:
Cote d'Ivoire celebrated World Statistics Day with a [statement by Kaba Nialé, Minister of the Economy and Finance] (files/CotedIvoire_Journéemondialedelastatistique.pdf). In her statement, Ms. Nialé urged statisticians and demographers from Cote d'Ivoire to demonstrate scientific independence, professionalism, impartiality, transparency and rigor in the exercise of their function to make available to government, development partners and all users, better statistical data to ensure a better life for the citizens of Cote d'Ivoire.

 The statement was also the focus on a programme entitled “Le 13 Heures de RTI 1 du 20 Octobre 2015 avec Fatou Fofana” on national TV ([You Tube video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qirkqH1Efo0&feature=youtu.be)).

posts.title: Latvia's opinion leaders sharing their vision of the role of data in their lives and in society
posts.text:
On the occasion of World Statistics Day 2015 the [Central Statistical Bureau of Latvia] (http://www.csb.gov.lv/en) prepared several [videos] (https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLPPdEBjeUQWHJJge4sacrOZxQf_DeSGEu) of opinion leaders sharing their vision of the role of data in their lives and in society as a whole. The videos are currently available in Latvian but English subtitles will be released shortly. 

 [![CSB Latvia](img/posts/Latvia_video.png)](http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLPPdEBjeUQWHJJge4sacrOZxQf_DeSGEu)

posts.title: Expertise France supported World Statistics Day
posts.text: [Expertise France] (http://www.expertisefrance.fr), a the French international technical expertise agency with the aim of increasing the mobilization capacities of the various areas of public technical expertise in the international arena, in order to better respond to the growing needs of developing or emergent countries in terms of assistance to public policies, supported World Statistics Day with a [special poster] (img/posts/France_poster.png).

posts.title: Statistical Office of the Republic of Serbia issues press release on the occasion of World Statistics Day
posts.text:
On the occasion of World Statistics Day the Statistical Office of the [Republic of Serbia (SORS)] (http://webrzs.stat.gov.rs/WebSite/Default.aspx) issued a [press release] (http://webrzs.stat.gov.rs/WebSite/userFiles/file/Aktuelnosti/DanStat/II%20WSD.pdf) emphasizing “the critical role of high-quality official statistical information in analysis, planning and decision-making policy” and stressing “the importance of sustainable national capacity to produce reliable and timely statistics and indicators measuring a country’s progress.”

The Office also posted a photo gallery “[SORS - Part of world statistics family] (http://webrzs.stat.gov.rs/WebSite/Public/PageView.aspx?pKey=717)”.

posts.title: Biostatistics Group at McGill University celebrates the sweet way
posts.text:
The [Biostatistics group] (http://www.mcgill.ca/epi-biostat-occh/) at [McGill University] (http://www.mcgill.ca) in Montreal (Canada) celebrated World Statistics Day in a sweet way. Approximately 45 students, faculty, and other appreciators of statistics gathered for cupcakes and coffee to celebrate before their weekly [seminar series] (http://www.mcgill.ca/epi-biostat-occh/news-events/seminars/biostatistics).

posts.title: Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights marks World Statistics Day
posts.text:
The [Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR)](http://www.ohchr.org/EN/Pages/WelcomePage.aspx) is joining the World Statistics Day 2015’s call for “Better data. Better lives.” by underlining the need for a human rights-based approach to data and statistics, and to make sure that adequate methodologies for the collection of disaggregated data pertaining to marginalized groups are developed and implemented.

 For more information, visit the [website](http://www.ohchr.org/EN/NewsEvents/Pages/WorldStatisticsDay2015.aspx) of the Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights.

posts.title: ILO supports World Statistics Day
posts.text: The Director-General of the [International Labour Organization (ILO)] (http://www.ilo.org), Guy Ryder, issued a message on the occasion of World Statistics Day in which he “commends the huge progress made by many institutions producing labour and decent work statistics around the world, particularly national statistical offices and ministries of labour”. He also reassured his organization's “clear conviction that better labour market data will guide the creation of better jobs leading to better lives.” The full statement is available [here] (http://www.ilo.org/global/about-the-ilo/who-we-are/ilo-director-general/statements-and-speeches/WCMS_416470/lang--en/index.htm).

posts.title: Statistics New Zealand celebrates
posts.text:
[Statistics New Zealand] (http://www.stats.govt.nz/) reinforced the message shown on their website [Thanks, New Zealand! ...] (img/posts/NZL_website.png) by half page adverts in the three major New Zealand newspapers – the [NZ Herald] (http://www.nzherald.co.nz), the [Dominion Post] (http://www.dominionpost.com/), and [The Press] (http://www.stuff.co.nz/the-press/). 

![](img/posts/NewZealand_2.jpg)

###### (Carol Slappendel, the Deputy Government Statistician for Operations displaying one of the Papers.)

Statistics New Zealand also released a new report, [Women at work: 1991-2013](http://www.stats.govt.nz/browse_for_stats/people_and_communities/Women/women-occupation/women-occupation-media-release.aspx), as part of their celebrations. This report shows that the representation of women working in life science professions (biology and environmental science) doubled between 1991 and 2013 and also highlights that women are now just as likely as men to have qualifications in the area of natural and physical sciences. In 2013, this was the only field of study that had no high-level sex segregation – this field includes most sciences such as biology, chemistry, earth science, and mathematics.

Finally, Chief Methodologist, Vince Galvin, presented a talk on 30 years of the Household Labour Force Survey. 

[![Statistics New Zealand](img/posts/NZL_video2.png)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-bwJKRUrdaM “Vince Galvin - 30 years of the Household Labour Force Survey”)

posts.title: Happy ‘Te rā whakanui i te tauanga’ from New Zealand!
posts.text:
As one of the first National Statistics Offices to see the light on World Statistics Day, [Statistics New Zealand] (http://www.stats.govt.nz/) began its celebrations with a tweet from our Government Statistician, Liz MacPherson.

 Statistics New Zealand also produced a video to show how statistics keep our country moving forward.

posts.title: World Statistics Day in Finland
posts.text:
On the World Statistics Day, [Statistics Finland] (http://www.stat.fi/) will arrange open lectures for educational institutions on the way statistics can be used and introduces its activities. In cooperation with the [Bank of Finland] (http://www.suomenpankki.fi) the "Portrait of a nation – 150 years of statistics on Finland" exhibition is ongoing at the Bank of Finland museum. The exhibition showcases the evolution of Finnish statistical production and, for example, the beginnings of national income and census calculation. In addition, the exhibition offers a chance to meet the average Finn from 1900, 1956 and 2014. The exhibition opened at the end of September also celebrates Statistics Finland's 150th anniversary. You can learn more about the [exhibition online](http://www.rahamuseo.fi/vaihtuvat_nayttelyt/kansakunnan-kuva/en/). 

On the World Statistics Day, an open lecture on what GDP measures will be arranged at the Bank of Finland museum.

Statistics Finland will also open a new e-course in Tilastokoulu (eCourse in statistics) concerning the history of statistics.

posts.title: Abu Dhabi celebrates World Statistics Day
posts.text:
The [Statistics Centre - Abu Dhabi] (http://www.scad.ae) joins the global statistical community in celebrating the World Statistics Day of Statistics under the theme “Better data, Better lives” to educate the society about the significance of statistics in the formulation and support of development strategies and goals at the national, regional and global dimensions. In his word marking this occasion, HE Butti Al Qubaisi, Director General of SCAD thanked the staff members for their dedicated work to improve statistics in the Emirate of Abu Dhabi, emphasizing the need for continued efforts in the implementation of SCAD’s strategy (2016-2020). HE Al Qubaisi also invited his strategic partners and the general public to take part in the centre’s activities marking the Worlds Statistics Day, which include: a symposium on the Implications of Data Revolution for Better Statistics (Keynote lecturer: Professor Enrico Giovannini), social media activities messages, including a Facebook quiz for the public with prizes for winners, an open day with the public at the Shopping Mall, featuring a variety of activities, including a stand acquainting the public with SCAD’s smart phone apps and services, stage events and competitions, a kids corner and kids’ books and gifts, and a survey to measure statistical awareness.

 Our main partners in this initiative are: Majid TV Channel, Ministry of Culture, Youth and Community Development, Zayed Foundation for Humanitarian Care and representatives and guests from the above institutions.

For more information, please visit our social media account: adstatistics [Facebook]    (https://www.facebook.com/adstatistics), [Twitter](https://mobile.twitter.com/adstatistics), [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/adstatistics/).

posts.title: OECD celebrates World Statistics Day
posts.text:
To celebrate World Statistics Day, the [Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)] (http://www.oecd.org) will hold a “Statistics Day” conference under the World Statistics Day theme– Better Data. Better Lives. The conference will showcase statistics from all OECD directorates through interactive displays, presentations and poster displays. The conference will be opened by the Secretary-General of the OECD with a keynote address from Yann Algan, Professor of Economics, [Sciences Po] (http://www.sciencespo.fr), Paris . The conference is scheduled for early December.

 Additionally, OECD has a webpage for [World Statistics Day] (http://www.oecd.org/statistics/world-statistics-day-2015-better-data-better-lives.htm).

posts.title: FAO supports World Statistics Day 2015
posts.text:
As a major producer of data and statistics, the [Food and Agriculture Organizations of the United Nations (FAO)] (http://www.fao.org/) strongly supports the designation of 20 October 2015 as World Statistics Day and is actively promoting this to Members Countries and partners, as well as to FAO staff, encouraging them to join the celebration. In this respect, FAO has itself launched a dedicated web page on the Organization’s [web site] (http://www.fao.org/economic/ess/ess-events/wsd/en/) to bring the attention of the general public to this important theme.

 There will also be a number of internal events taking place within FAO, for example the launch of a FAO Technical Network of Statisticians. All activities will be reported on the dedicated FAO web page for [World Statistics Day] (http://www.fao.org/economic/ess/ess-events/wsd/en/) as they unfold.

posts.title: World Statistics Day in Montenegro
posts.text:
The [Statistical Office of Montenegro] (http://www.monstat.org) is joining the global initiative to celebrate and in that manner emphasize the importance of official statistics.

 Recognising the strong connection between education on all levels as well as professional audience and the importance of [2030 Sustainable Development Agenda](https://sustainabledevelopment.un.org/post2015/transformingourworld) for Montenegro, the Statistical Office of Montenegro will organize public presentations in institutions at all levels of education and public appearances of the Director General of Statistical Office of Montenegro.

 Public presentations in institutions will be held at kindergarten, primary school, secondary school and faculty. Representatives of Statistical Office of Montenegro will focus on 17 sustainable development goals trying to familiarize the audience with them through practical examples on a colourful and simple way, and of course having in mind different levels of education of audience.

 The Director General of Statistical Office of Montenegro, Msc Gordana Radojevic, will appear in a morning programme of the state television with the greatest coverage and viewership in the country.

posts.title: Hearing the voice of ordinary citizens
posts.text:
[Statistics South Africa] (http://www.statssa.gov.za) is conducting a Citizen Satisfaction Survey in the province of KwaZulu-Natal between 12 October and 20 November. The Survey is a joint effort between the [KwaZulu-Natal Office of the Premier] (http://www.kznpremier.gov.za) and Statistics South Africa and will gauge the level of service delivery satisfaction. Just over 200 fieldworkers armed with tablets will start visiting the over 20 000 selected household, asking questions about their satisfaction with services delivered by government ranging from housing and sanitation to law enforcement and transport in the province.

 The survey also marks a new era for Stats SA as we launch a paperless survey for the first time. This will also shorten the turnaround time on the processing and release of data. The findings of the Citizen Satisfaction Survey will province the KwaZulu-Natal government with the information it needs to assess the current status of service delivery in the province and allow the Office of the Premier to make informed decisions towards making people’s lives better. See also [here] (http://www.statssa.gov.za/?p=5582).

posts.title: Colombia is organizing more that 100 events all over the country in support of “Better data. Better lives.”
posts.text:
The [National Administrative Department of Statistics (DANE)] (http://www.dane.gov.co) is proud to join the commemoration of the second World Statistics Day, with the theme “Better data, better life”. To this end, DANE has organized various events across Colombia aimed at fostering statistical culture and data dissemination through lectures, forums, interactive workshops and virtual competitions on statistical knowledge. These events are aimed at diverse public, such as children, university students, academics and researcher, government official at national and territorial levels, as well as entrepreneurs in the public sector and DANE’s team.

 The agenda includes more than 100 events organized in the following way: 79 events that will take place in 18 municipalities across the national territory and 27 events in Bogotá D.C. Additionally, we are happy to welcome 2 international experts who will share their knowledge in the field of open data usage, 2 lecturers with academic and research background as well as 4 territorial entities as panelists. More information on the events can be found [here] (http://www.dane.gov.co/semanaestadistica2015/).

posts.title: Central Bank of Aruba marks World Statistics Day with a technical seminar
posts.text:
As one of the two major producers of statistics on Aruba, the [Central Bank of Aruba (CBA)] (http://www.cbaruba.org/cba/home.do) will be celebrating World Statistics Day together with other data compilers and daily users of statistics on a technical level.

 The celebration will be in the form of a technical seminar focusing on the importance of statistics in our daily lives. Three guest speakers have been invited to make a presentation at this seminar. The first speaker is Mr. Henk Lub, a former employee of De Nederlandsche Bank (DNB) and the International Monetary Fund ([IMF] (http://imf.org)), who will elaborate on the role of central bank statistics. Mrs. Desiree Helder of the [Centraal Bureau voor de Statistiek (CBS)](http://www.cbs.aw) is the second speaker. She will focus on the role of statistics in our community from the perspective of the CBS. The third speaker, Mr. Ryan Peterson, professor at the [University of Aruba (UA)] (http://www.ua.aw), will discuss the topic big data. More information can be found in the [CBA press release] (http://www.cbaruba.org/cba/readBlob.do?id=3560).

posts.title: Italy's Ministero degli Affari Esteri e della Cooperazione Internazionale supports World Statistics Day
posts.text:
Italy's [Ministero degli Affari Esteri e della Cooperazione Internazionale (MFAIC)] (http://www.esteri.it/mae/en/) will participate in World Statistics Day 2015, convinced of the strategic role in official statistical data in sustainable development policies. “Better Data, Better Lives” is also the motto of the 5th Italian Day of Statistics , which is led by [ISTAT] (http://www.istat.it/) as a national event  and followed by additional initiatives organised by local offices in collaboration with the academic world and the national statistics system.

 In this context, the MFAIC will publish its “Statistical Yearbook 2015 – The Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation in numbers” on-line on World Statistics Day. An English language compendium of data regarding the activities of the Farnesina’s central headquarters and the entire diplomatic network abroad, bearing witness to the ministry’s commitment to the production of quality statistical data in the service of transparency.

posts.text: The [Czech Statistical Office (CZSO)] (https://www.czso.cz/csu/czso/home) has put together an extensive [programme] (https://www.czso.cz/csu/czso/world-statistics-day) in celebration of World Statistics Day 2015. posts.title: Fiji joins the World Statistics Day celebrations
posts.text: To mark World Statistics Day 2015, the [School of Economics (FBE)] (http://www.econ.fbe.usp.ac.fj/) of the [University of the South Pacific] (http://www.usp.ac.fj) is hosting a panel discussion on the theme “Better data. Better lives.” to address aspects of data quality, dissemination, data accessibility, and use for public policy and nation building in the Pacific region. Speakers will also examine recent developments on how big data revolution can shape future of evidence based public policy. Opportunity will be given to participants to ask questions and to share their views. Speakers include Mr. Epeli Waqavonovono (Government Statistician, [Fiji Bureau of Statistics] (http://www.statsfiji.gov.fj) ) and Dr. Alessio Cangiano and Dr. Manoj Pandey (The University of the South Pacific). Dr. Manoranjan Mohanty (The University of the South Pacific) will moderate the discussion.

posts.title: University of Zurich is celebrating World Statistics Day

posts.title: WFP will celebrate World Statistics Day with a seminar on how its innovative food security measurement systems are at the core of its efforts to achieve Zero Hunger
posts.text:
A core function of the [World Food Programme (WFP)] (http://www.wfp.org/) food security analysis and trends service [(VAM)] (http://vam.wfp.org/) is to estimate and communicate who, how many, where and why people are food insecure. WFP will celebrate the World Statistics Day with a talk on why investing in primary and secondary data collection and analysis are fundamental for the design and implementation of food assistance programmes worldwide.

 The event will showcase WFP’s food security analysis and measurement capacity, presenting the [Consolidated Approach to Reporting Indicators (CARI)] (https://resources.vam.wfp.org/CARI) of Food Security. The CARI combines key food security indicators, including the Food Consumption Score, the Food Expenditure Share and Livelihoods Coping Strategies to access the food security situation of a given country. Using datasets from a recent survey, both the theory and the methodology will be discussed. The salient features of [mVAM](http://vam.wfp.org/sites/mvam_monitoring/), a mobile food security and markets monitoring system, will also be presented to demonstrate our ability to safely access near real-time food security information quickly and inexpensively from hard to reach places like war-stricken countries of Iraq and Yemen.

posts.title: FAO scheduled to release statistical pocketbooks 2015 on World Statistics Day
posts.text:
The [Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)] (http://www.fao.org/) will release its new [“FAO Statistical Pocketbook 2015”] (http://www.fao.org/3/a-i4691e.pdf) on 20 October 2015. This publication is part of the FAO Statistical Yearbook suite of products. The first part of the book includes thematic spreads with data visualizations (graphs, charts, and maps) with basic text. The second part has country-level tables for a selected number of indicators.

 In addition, a special publication [“FAO Statistical Pocketbook – Coffee 2015”] (http://www.fao.org/3/a-i4985e.pdf) focuses on coffee and includes country profiles with key indicators related to coffee for selected years. Topics include a general overview (poverty, population, GDP per capita, etc.), production of coffee and related crops, consumption of coffee and related products, trade, prices and the environment.

posts.title: World Statistics Day 2015 is celebrated in Rwanda
posts.text:
Rwanda, through the National Institute of [Statistics of Rwanda (NISR)] (http://www.statistics.gov.rw) will join the rest of the world to celebrate the World Statistics Day. Various activities have been organized during October and November 2015.

 In October 2015, NISR has organized two workshops with university lecturers to discuss the accessibility of official statistics through different online data dissemination platforms that are currently being used by NISR. NISR has also organized a competition with graduate and postgraduate students of higher learning institutions (both public and private) in Rwanda to produce winning static infographics that focuses on quantitative analysis and visualization under the topic ‘The profile and trends of businesses in Rwanda’.

 Both [NISR](http://www.statistics.gov.rw) and [UNICEF Rwanda] (http://www.unicef.org/rwanda/) are also planning to organize the children summit where children will be exposed to basis statistical skills and concepts under the public statistical literacy programme of the second National Strategy for the Development of Statistics (NSDS2) in Rwanda. It will be accompanied by producing a children friendly readable statistical report with key statistics mostly about children and maternal health statistics.

 In addition to that, a two-day workshop with statisticians in public and private institutions is scheduled on 22-23 October 2015 to talk about the compilation and importance of the Rwanda Statistical Year Book that puts together both surveys and administrative statistics proceeded by different Ministries, Departments and Agencies (MDAs).

 Celebration event will continue through November 2015 with the celebration of the [2015 African Statistics Day] (blog.html?i=19) and the NISR 10 years of policy support. During the event, a high level session that aims at bring private sector on board to support development of statistics in Rwanda will be organized under the theme: “Better Data for Better lives: Harnessing Modern Technology to Enhance National Statistical System”.

posts.title: Eurostat releases a shortvideo demonstrating that life is indeed better, and more fun, with statistics
posts.text:
[Eurostat] (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat) celebrates this year's World Statistics Day with a [short funny video] (http://ec.europa.eu/avservices/video/player.cfm?ref=I110391&sitelang=en&videolang=DE) and a news release. Both focus on the global theme “Better data. Better lives.” The video illustrates in a humorous way that statistics can be fun. The news release highlights the links between Eurostat data and the priorities of the European Commission as set out in the recent publication “European Statistics for European Policies”. 

 The video is available [here] (http://ec.europa.eu/avservices/video/player.cfm?ref=I110391&sitelang=en&videolang=DE) in 24 languages.

posts.title: Lao PDR celebrates National Statistical Day and World Statistics Day

posts.title: Argentina’s National University of Tucuman celebrates World Statistics Day and anniversary of Inter-American Statistical Institute
posts.text:
From 19-22 October 2015, the [Faculty of Economic Sciences of the National University of Tucuman] (http://face.unt.edu.ar/web/) in Argentina will celebrate World Statistics Day and commemorate the 75th anniversary of the [Inter-American Statistical Institute (IASI)](http://www.contraloria.gob.pa/inec/iasi/ing_index.html).

 The Institute of Statistical Research of the Faculty of Economic Sciences and the Inter-American Statistical Institute (IASI) are organizing a series of academic events during these four days, including conferences, courses, and discussion panels, which will count with the participation of distinguished professors and researchers from various countries.

 For more information, visit this [page](http://face.unt.edu.ar/web/blog/la-face-sera-sede-de-la-celebracion-por-el-dia-mundial-de-estadistica-y-los-75-anos-de-vida-del-iasi/).

posts.title: What’s your number, Tokelau?
posts.text: On the occasion of World Statistics Day, the [Tokelau National Statistics Office] (http://www.tokelau.org.nz) issued an [online bulletin](http://www.tokelau.org.nz/Bulletin/October+2015/World+Statistics+Day.html) on how they produce official statistics. In the bulletin the Jaap (“iapi”) Jasperse, Statistics Adviser, writes: “Rather than dazzle the reader with lots of figures about the three Tokelau atolls and their inhabitants, we’ll use this opportunity to show what statistics are relevant for Samoa’s northern neighbour Tokelau today, and how they are obtained.”

posts.title: Australian Bureau of Statistics - taking the theme of 'Better Data. Better Lives.' to heart.
posts.text:
The [Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS)] (http://www.abs.gov.au) will release the results of the 2015 Community Trust in [ABS Statistics Survey](http://www.abs.gov.au/ausstats/abs@.nsf/mf/1014.0) on World Statistics Day. This survey measures the current levels of trust in the Australian Bureau of Statistics and its statistical output. It also compares results to a similar survey conducted in 2010 for the last World Statistics Day.

 The Australian Bureau of Statistics has already been celebrating World Statistics Day on its Facebook page with their [ChatStats competition] (https://www.facebook.com/absstats). 

 The headline event for World Statistics Day celebrations is the ABS Transformation Showcase Expo. This Expo will highlight some key achievements in the [ABS transformation program] (http://www.abs.gov.au/ausstats/abs@.nsf/Lookup/by Subject/1005.0~2015-19~Main Features~Transforming for the future~5) and will be attended by ABS staff and invited external stakeholders.

 The Australian Statistician, David W. Kalisch, said; “The 2015 World Statistics Day theme is ‘Better Data. Better Lives’ which resonates well with the ABS’ own transformation agenda - the ABS is rebuilding its statistical infrastructure so that we can more readily provide information that will help policy makers improve the lives of all Australians. Essentially, the World Statistics Day theme is what we are going to be working towards over the next five years.”

posts.title: African Development Bank celebrates World Statistics Day with a series of seminars
posts.text:
The [African Development Bank (AfDB)] (http://www.afdb.org) joins the rest of the global statistical community in celebrating World Statistics Day. It has planned a series of seminars from 19-23 October 2015 at the Bank’s Headquarters in Abidjan, Cote d'Ivoire. The main objective of the seminar series is to bring together producers and users of statistics within the AfDB, with the aim of showcasing the statistical activities already underway, as well as future programs planned in response to the current demands of the [Data Revolution] (http://www.undatarevolution.org) and the [2030 Sustainable Development Agenda] (https://sustainabledevelopment.un.org/post2015/transformingourworld).

posts.title: Guyana is observing Caribbean and World Statistics Day 2015
posts.text:
The [Bureau of Statistics (BoS)] (http://www.statisticsguyana.gov.gy) of Guyana is observing [Caribbean Statistics Day] (blog.html?o=CARICOM) on 15 October and World Statistics Day on 20 October 2015, with a range of activities at its office at 57 High Street in Kingston.

 The activities span from 12 – 20 October and include outreach visits to schools, an open Day at the Bureau of Statistics (15 October), where BoS staff and colleagues from other government statistical units will invite the public to view a mini exhibition of statistics and brochures, along with Powerpoint presentations highlighting and promoting the importance of statistics, a Mini Health Fair and a domino and table tennis competition.

 Banners will be mounted at the BoS Headquarters and the Annex Office in Georgetown.

 In addition, the Bureau of Statistics announced a [Poster Competition] (http://www.statisticsguyana.gov.gy/pubs/Poster%20Competition%20Background.pdf) to celebrate Caribbean Statistics and World Statistics Day on the 15th and 20th of October 2015 respectively. This competition is aimed at raising awareness of the organisation and the importance of statistics. The general theme is Better Data, Better Lives, however for the poster competition the theme is “The importance of Statistics in everyday life.” The BoS intends to feature the winning design on its official website.

 More information can be found [here] (http://www.statisticsguyana.gov.gy/caribbeanstatsday.html).

posts.title: Central Department of Statistics & Information (CDSI) of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia joins the international community for the celebration of World Statistics Day 2015
posts.text:

posts.title: Statistical Centre for the Cooperation Council for the Arab Countries of the Gulf (GCC-Stat) joins the celebrations
posts.text:
For the first time since its establishment in June 2011, the [Statistical Centre for the Cooperation Council for the Arab Countries of the Gulf (GCC-Stat)] (http://www.gccstat.org) joins with the rest of the world in celebrating World Statistics Day 2015 on 20 October 2015.

 In preparation for the event, the GCC-Stat website now contains a link to the World Statistics Day website. GCC-Stat is also actively promoting World Statistics Day through social media [twitter] (https://twitter.com/@gccstat), [Facebook] (https://www.facebook.com/gccstat), [Instagram] (http://instagram.com/gccstat), its own [website] (http://gccstat.org/en/) and a media release for distribution through all the GCC countries (United Arab Emirates, Kingdom of Bahrain, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, Sultanate of Oman, State of Qatar and State of Kuwait).

posts.title: Central Agency for Public Mobilization and Statistics of Egypt is planning an extensive programme in celebration of World Statistics Day
posts.text:
The [Central Agency for Public Mobilization and Statistics (CAPMAS)] (http://www.capmas.gov.eg) will organize different [events] (files/EGY_Activities.pdf) to celebrate the second World Statistics Day 2015. The main event will be the official celebratory conference “Better data. Better lives.”, which will be held at the CAPMAS main hall on 20 October under auspices of H.E. Gen. Abdel Fatah El SISI – President of Egypt. Among the speakers of the conference H.E. Gen. Abou Bakr El-Gendy – CAPMAS President, H.E. Eng. Sherif Ismaail- the prime Minister, and some ministries amongst them Dr. Ashraf El Araby-Minister of Planning, and Dr. Ghada Wally – Minister of Social Solidarity. The programme is available in [Arabic] (files/EGY_Agenda_Arabic.pdf) and [English] (files/EGY_Agenda_English.pdf). 

 The CAPMAS celebration will also involve international experts through organizing sessions and workshops - [UN Coordination Office in Cairo] (http://jobs.undp.org/cj_view_job.cfm?cur_job_id=35584) will organize a session on “SDGs in Egypt: opportunities and steps forward”, Ms. Nathalie Milbach Bouché – UN Regional Team Leader, Inclusive Growth & Sustainable Development will be one presenter in the main event. A half-day workshop on “SDGs, data requirements, and innovative technologies”. The [World Bank] (http://www.worldbank.org) will organize both a session on “Assessing Welfare of Egyptian Household” and a workshop on the methodology for measuring poverty in Egypt. The [International Labour Organization (ILO)] (http://www.ilo.org) will organize a session on “Youth Employment and Aspirations” and the [International Organization for Migration (IOM)] (http://www.iom.int) will organize a session on “International and Regional Migration in Egypt”.

 At the regional level, CAPMAS jointly with [Economic Researches Forum (ERF)] (http://www.erf.org.eg) will organize a regional training course for statisticians from Arab countries on “Analysis of Economic Census Data” in order to upgrade their statistical capacity.

 CAPMAS is coordinating with the Ministry of Education for considering the period from 17 - 22 October 2015 as the week for statistics to raise the statistical awareness for the students through the material prepared by CAPMAS, as well as the coordination with Postal Authority for issuing stamp of the celebration, and organizing exhibitions in the universities and scientific centers to promote CAPMAS publications.

 A broadened conference will be held on Tuesday 20 October 2015 to deliberate and discuss emerging issues in statistics and the relevance of official statistics to development. Participants will be prominent international, national and regional experts. CAPMAS will announce the results of field surveys such as the Time Use Survey and Constituents of the local community survey. In addition the extensive programme will inlcude: a competition for the best Statistical Article “the role of statistics for the society development”, a media campaign for raising the statistical awareness (posters on the public transportation means), sending mobiles SMS to inform the public about the celebration, a press release, a booklet on the prominent role of statistics to increase the individual's standard of living, presenting the prominent events at CAPMAS website and the digital board and displaying boards about World Statistics Day all over the CAPMAS regional offices. It will also include a scientific conference, an exhibition of CAPMAS' publications in collaboration with different organizations, institutions & universities, honoring senior statisticians, an overview over the history of CAPMAS, the launching of CAPMAS' new website and last but not least the distribution of souvenirs.

posts.title: Department of Statistics Malaysia sponsors StatsRun 2015, a Statistics Talk
posts.text:
[StatsRun] (http://home.hooha.asia/STATS-2015.aspx) will be held on 17 October 2015 morning at Putrajaya. The objective of this event is to encourage the community to adopt a healthy life style as well to promote World Statistics Day among Malaysians. The event is expected to attract more than 4,000 participants, includes professional and amateur runner, government servants, students and public. This is the second time this event being held. StatsRun 2015 is open to all Malaysians. The competition will consists of 13 categories, among others open categories (10 km) for men, women, veteran man and veteran women as well as special categories for the government servant and association chamber members. This is a combination of social and sports toward increasing the awareness of the important of statistics for the nation building.

 Statistics Talk will be the main event for the celebration of World Statistics Day and will be held on 20 October 2015 at Putrajaya organised by the [Department of Statistics Malaysia (DOSM)](http://www.statistics.gov.my). This event will be officiated by YB Dato’ Sri Abdul Wahid Omar, Minister at the [Prime Minister Department] (http://www.jpm.gov.my/). The talk will be moderated by Mr. Shaik Abdul Rasheed Abdul Ghaffour, Assistant Governor, [Central Bank of Malaysia] (http://www.bnm.gov.my). The panellists are Tan Sri Dato’ Seri Dr. Sulaiman Mahbob, Chairman, [Telekom Malaysia Berhad] (www.tm.com.my) , Professor Datuk Dr. Noor Azlan Ghazali, Vice Chancellor, [National University of Malaysia] (http://www.ukm.my), Datuk Zakaria Abd. Wahab, Editor-in-Chief, [BERNAMA] (http://www.bernama.com) and Ms. Nazaria Baharudin, Senior Director, [Department of Statistics] (http://www.statistics.gov.my). The panel will discuss matters related to “The Power of Statistics”. The expected audience for this event are 350 people, comprising statisticians, lecturers, university students, government servants and ex-statisticians.

 Statistics Talk at a smaller scale is also organised at Universities as an effort to increase the statistical literacy among students. The talk will be delivered by officers from DOSM and discuss the importance of statistics in national planning. The Statistics talks are being held at [Malaysia University of Science and Technology] (http://must.edu.my), [National University of Malaysia] (http://www.ukm.my/v6/), [Universiti Utara Malaysia](http://www.uum.edu.my) and [Universiti Teknologi Mara] (http://www.uitm.edu.my/index.php/en/) from September to October 2015.

posts.title: Department of Statistics of Malaysia kicks off its activities for World Statistics Day 2015 with community outreach
posts.text:
The [Department of Statistics, Malaysia (DOSM)] (http://www.statistics.gov.my) along with stakeholders, universities and private sectors is organising many [programmes] (https://www.statistics.gov.my/index.php?r=column/cone&menu_id=NHg3RnVLZlJ1YWoxYVUyZ0kzS1FNZz09) to commemorate the celebration of the World Statistics Day (WSD) 2015.

 The programme started out with statistics sessions with communities. A total of 13 sessions with the community and respondents on the area of statistics were held all over the nation from March until August 2015. The objective of these sessions was to explain the importance and usefulness of statistics compiled by DOSM for the formulation of national development policies and administration. The seminars also highlighted the importance of cooperation from community and respondents in the success of the census/survey conducted by DOSM. From these seminars, the relations between the communities and DOSM will be strengthened and generate better understanding.

posts.title: Boston University College of Arts and Sciences marks World Statistics Day

posts.title: Italian National Institute of Statistics (Istat) joins the celebrations for World Statistics Day 2015
posts.text:
The [Italian National Institute of Statistics (Istat)] (http://www.istat.it) joins the World Statistics Day 2015 with an event, “Better data. Better life”, to be held in Rome on 20 October, in partnership with the [Italian Statistical Society (SIS)] (http://www.sis-statistica.it).

 On the same date, Italy celebrates the Italian Day of Statistics, now in its fifth edition. In line with the UN guidelines, the focus of the Day will be the need to produce reliable and timely statistics and indicators to measure a country’s progress, but also to use new measurement and analysis approaches in support of policies for sustainable development.

 The opening ceremony will start with the institutional greetings, among the others, of the Permanent Representative of Italy to the United Nations in Rome. The Presidents of Istat and Sis will then proceed with the signing of the “Data for Sustainable Development - A Statement for World Statistics Day”, sponsored by the Royal Statistical Society and the American Statistical Association. The ceremony will conclude with the awarding of the national winner of the [International Statistical Literacy Project (ISLP)](http://iase-web.org/islp/).

 A panel of experts will discuss the theme of “Sustainable development and social progress”, which is the focus of the second part of the day. Besides the national event, which can also be followed in live streaming on the institutional website, Istat, in collaboration with organizations, local institutions and universities promotes about thirty-five regional initiatives and activities.

 All material will be available on a designated [website] (http://www.istat.it/it/archivio/169060).

posts.title: Irish Central Statistics Office engages with students of all ages though a professional exhibition and at Ireland's Maths Week
posts.text:
The [Irish Central Statistics Office (CSO)] (http://www.cso.ie/) is celebrating World Statistics Day with a number of activities. Firstly, the CSO has partnered with the [Portuguese Exploristica] (http://www.exploristica.com/) team to bring Exploristica, an engaging, interactive set of educational games, to Ireland. The CSO has partnered with the [Lifetime Labs] (http://www.lifetimelab.ie/) in Cork to curate this exhibition and will launch this project on World Statistics Day. Initially, Exploristica will be exhibited in the Lifetime Labs, but, it is easily transportable so it will make a tour of Ireland through regular annual events like the [BT Young Scientist] (http://btyoungscientist.com/) and [SciFest] (http://scifest.ie/) as well as being curated in other cities.

 Secondly, CSO will publish our [Statistical Yearbook of Ireland 2015] (http://www.cso.ie/en/releasesandpublications/statisticalyearbookofireland/) on World Statistics Day. The Statistical Yearbook of Ireland 2015 presents a comprehensive picture of Ireland today. It provides detailed information, tables and graphs across a wide range of topics. These include the population, labour market, education, crime, the economy, agriculture, industry, services, prices, housing, and the environment. The yearbook is published as a mobile friendly web publication.

 Thirdly, the CSO will partner with [University College Cork] (http://www.ucc.ie) to present a series of short presentations on statistical topics of interest. Statistics will engage the audience will topics like open data and big data and will provide a window to our statistics products and services as well as our wealth of data.

 World Statistics Day will build on the CSO outreach work in [Maths Week] (http://www.mathsweek.ie/), taking place a week earlier in Ireland where over a quarter of a million students engage in all things mathematical. During Maths Week the CSO Director General Padraig Dalton will launch our new [CensusAtSchool questionnaire] (http://www.censusatschool.ie/en/take-part/questionnaires/phase15-16), Felix Coleman, a CSO statistician, will publish the finding of the CensusAtSchool 2014/2015 questionnaire. Minister Damien Engliah TD, Minister of State for Skills, Research and Innovation will launch our [statistical poster competition] (http://www.cso.ie/en/studentscorner/johnhoopermedalforstatisticscompetition/) and our [app building competition](http://apps4gaps.ie/). In addition, there will be lots of engagement at school level with themed school visits.

 Ireland has an exciting two weeks ahead with World Statistics Day and Maths week creating plenty of opportunities to engage.

posts.title: Statistics Sweden will launch its new website “Sweden in Figures” on World Statistics Day
posts.text:
To celebrate World Statistics Day, [Statistics Sweden](http://www.scb.se) is launching the website [Sverige i siffror (Sweden in Figures)] (http://www.scb.se/sverigeisiffror/). Statistics Sweden created a new concept to make their data available to a broader audience. Information technologies have driven changes in the ways users want to consume statistics. With the increasing flow of information, users need to get information quickly before digging deeper into reports and databases. Information needs to be simple to find, fast to interpret, and easy to dig deeper into.

 In addition to the website, Statistics Sweden has developed a teacher’s guide and a booklet.

posts.title: The Department of Census and Statistics of Sri Lanka is adding a high level World Statistics Day Forum to its extensive programme for World Statistics Day

posts.title: Eurostat celebrates World Statistics Day
posts.text:
[Eurostat] (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/main) is the statistical office of the European Union situated in Luxembourg. Its task is to provide the European Union with statistics at European level that enable comparisons between countries and regions. Eurostat will celebrate this year's World Statistics Day with a news release and a short video, which will be published on Monday 19 October. Both will focus on the global theme “Better data. Better lives.” In the news release, Eurostat will highlight the links between its data and the priorities of the European Commission as set out in the recent publication [“European Statistics for European Policies”] (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/documents/4031688/7008709/KS-04-15-397-EN-N/).

 Nowadays European statistics are used in many different ways by a growing number of people.

 ![Eurostat](img/posts/Eurostat_users.png)

 In addition, the release will highlight recent work with a link to the lives of European citizens, such as [“Sustainable development in the European Union”](http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/documents/3217494/6987735/KS-GU-15-001-EN-N.pdf/), [“The EU in the World”] (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/documents/3217494/6975194/KS-EX-15-001-EN-N.pdf/), [“Quality of life – Facts and views”] (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/documents/3217494/6856423/KS-05-14-073-EN-N/), [“Being young in Europe today“] (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/documents/3217494/6776245/KS-05-14-031-EN-N.pdf/) and [“Smarter, greener, more inclusive? – Indicators to support the Europe 2020 strategy”] (http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/documents/3217494/6655013/KS-EZ-14-001-EN-N.pdf/).

Leshner from [Planet Labs] (https://www.planet.com) will talk about “Using Space to Help Life on Earth”; Anthony Vanky from [MIT Senseable City Lab] (http://senseable.mit.edu) will focus on “When Communities Talk Back: Data & Vizualization in the “Senseable City” and Hermann Habermann from the [National Academies of Sciences] (http://sites.nationalacademies.org/DBASSE/CNSTAT/index.htm) will look at “New Directions in the Use of Data”.

posts.title: Second Global Conference on Big Data for Official Statistics will take place on 20-22 October in Abu Dhabi
posts.text:
The [Second Global Conference on Big Data for Official Statistics] (http://unstats.un.org/unsd/trade/events/2015/abudhabi/default.asp) opens on 20 October 2015, which happens to be World Statistics Day. This day is celebrated all over the world under the general theme of “Better data. Better lives.” What better way of celebrating World Statistics Day than by highlighting the benefits of Big Data for Better Lives. Innovations in technology, widespread penetration of electronic devices, and the rapid rise in the use of technology for social purposes all bring fundamental changes to the availability of real-time information. Such massive, highly dynamic and weakly structured data is commonly referred to as Big Data.

 Recognizing the potential of Big Data, the UN Statistical Commission established in 2014 a global working group (GWG) [http://unstats.un.org/unsd/bigdata/] to provide strategic vision, direction and coordination of Big Data for official statistics. This is the 2nd Conference of the GWG, which will take the use of Big Data one step further from examples to guidance, and from pilot projects to production.

posts.title: World Statistics Day 2015 in Myanmar
posts.text:
World Statistics Day 2015 will be celebrated in Myanmar on 20 October through a commemorative event that will bring together producers and users of statistics from government, civil society, the private sector, media, and international organizations.

 The event will be opened by the Vice President of Myanmar, H.E. U Nyan Tun, and include a senior-level panel discussion on the theme of this year’s World Statistics Day “Better  Data. Better Lives.” Moreover, the new website for disseminating official statistics online will be launched and showcased at the event: [MMSIS - Myanmar Statistical Information Service] (http://www.mmsis.gov.mm). In the afternoon, attendants of the event will have the opportunity to follow three panel discussions, covering: (1) macroeconomic statistics, (2) agriculture, trade and investment statistics, and (3) social and vital statistics.

posts.title: The Royal Statistical Society Celebrates World Statistics Day with a number of initiatives
posts.text:
[The Royal Statistical Society (RSS)] (http://www.statslife.org.uk) will mark the second World Statistics Day on 20 October with a number of [initiatives] (http://www.statslife.org.uk/news/2499-rss-commemorates-world-statistics-day), including a statement, a reception in London for RSS fellows, statistics training for Members of Parliaments and a special edition of their flagship magazine [Significance] (http://www.statslife.org.uk/significance).

 The RSS has issued a [statement] (http://www.rss.org.uk/RSS/Influencing_Change/World_Statistics_Day_statement/RSS/Influencing_Change/World_Statistics_Day_statement.aspx?hkey=c261be5f-4079-4392-aa0e-35f6021aee6c) with the [International Statistical Institute (ISI)] (http://www.isi-web.org) and the [American Statistical Association (ASA)] (www.amstat.org) , to which more than 40 other organisations have signed up. It calls for 'a true data revolution' in order to properly be able to measure progress against the UN's ambitious new [Sustainable Development Goals] (https://sustainabledevelopment.un.org/post2015/transformingourworld). The statement urges that the opportunities provided by new technology and big data are properly utilised, emphasising that national statistical systems are central to this effort. To this end, the statement continues, 'systems must be properly financed, the development of statistical skills and expertise must be supported, and access to new tools and technology must be provided.'

 On the evening of WSD, the RSS is hosting a [reception] (http://www.statslife.org.uk/events/events-calendar/eventdetail/501/-/royal-statistical-society-celebrates-world-statistics-day-2015) for members and supporters of the society, as well as from partner organisations we have worked with throughout the past year. The event will include short speeches by the national statistician John Pullinger and Claire Melamed from the Overseas Development Institute who wrote a recent [report] (http://www.undatarevolution.org/report/) for the UN Secretary General on a ‘data revolution’ for international development. A number of local [events] (http://www.statslife.org.uk/events/events-calendar) are also planned for the day.

 20 October also happens to be the day that the RSS’ training for Members of Parliament will take place in parliament following our [Parliament Counts campaign] (http://www.rss.org.uk/rss/influencing_change/lobby_election_candidates/rss/influencing_change/lobby_election_candidates.aspx?hkey=51a5581b-e36f-4f6b-92d0-8e9299133fcd). The campaign sent thousands of messagesbto candidates around the country during the election campaign earlier in 2015, resulting in 324 candidates across the political spectrum signing up to the campaign, of which 55 are now elected members of parliament.

 Finally, the RSS will publish a World Statistics Day issue issue of [Significance magazine] (http://www.statslife.org.uk/significance) with six articles, all focusing on the importance of measuring sustainable development, all being made open access for a limited time from 20 October onwards. Claire Melamed will talk about how close we are to achieving a 'data revolution', while other articles focus on how statistics have been employed to examine issues as diverse as undernourishment, slavery and trends in travel.

posts.title: Republic of Kazakhstan is celebrating the 95th anniversary of the state statistics in Kazakhstan

posts.title: Creative workshop with students at Statistics Lithuania
posts.text:
On 6 October [Statistics Lithuania] (http://www.stat.gov.lt/en/home) organised a creative statistics and design workshop, dedicated to the commemoration of the World Statistics Day. The workshop was attended by 36 second-year students of [the Vilnius College of Technologies and Design] (http://www.dizainokolegija.lt/lt/) – to familiarise themselves with official statistics and, with the help of statisticians, to create infographics, presenting a statistical message in an attractive manner.

 At the beginning of the event, the students received information about the World Statistics Day, familiarised themselves with Statistics Lithuania, the main principles behind the production and dissemination of official statistics, the Official Statistics Portal, the Database of Indicators, etc.

 After a lunchbreak, work proceeded in small (four-student) groups. A statistician joined each group; the statistician helped the students to better understand the statistical domain selected, discover interesting statistics and come to a solution how to visualise them via infographics. For many students, it was not an easy task. “I had no idea that statistics covers such a wide range of topics. I am totally lost.”, said one of the participants. However, after three hours of intensive work, all student groups presented the first draft infographics.

 After the creative workshop, future designers will continue working individually and finalise the infographics by the World Statistics Day, commemorated on 20 October.

 “Our cooperation with the Vilnius College of Technologies and Design dates back many years. This mutual work provides students an opportunity to scrutinise an almost unfamiliar area, learn to find information in the abundance of data, use the Official Statistics Portal. As for our specialists, it is a great opportunity for them to try to explain complicated things in a simple language, look at the results of their work from a user's perspective”, said the Director General of Statistics Lithuania Vilija Lapėnienė in her introductory speech.

 More information on the event can be found [here](http://www.stat.gov.lt/en/home/-/asset_publisher/lbrXvLVHX2ln/content/studentu-kurybines-dirbtuves-lietuvos-statistikos-departamente?redirect=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.stat.gov.lt%2Fen%2Fhome%3Fp_p_id%3D101_INSTANCE_lbrXvLVHX2ln%26p_p_lifecycle%3D0%26p_p_state%3Dnormal%26p_p_mode%3Dview%26p_p_col_id%3Dcolumn-3%26p_p_col_count%3D1).

posts.title: UNIDO Celebrates World Statistics Day with a seminar on Measuring progress of nations in inclusive and sustainable industrialization
posts.text:
Around 50 national and international statisticians will be gathering at the Vienna International Centre from 14-16 October to celebrate World Statistics Day on the margins of an international seminar on the role of industrial statistics in the global monitoring of the sustainable development goals. The seminar is organized by the [Statistics Unit] (http://www.unido.org/statistics.html?ucg_no64=1%2Fdata%2Findex.php) of the [UN Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO)] (http://www.unido.org).

 In September the UN General assembly adopted the [2030 Sustainable Development Agenda] (https://sustainabledevelopment.un.org/post2015/transformingourworld) shaping the international development agenda for the period till 2030. Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) 9 is related to sustainable industrialization. UNIDO promotes the [Inclusive and Sustainable Industrial Development (ISID)] (https://isid.unido.org) around the world. [Industrial Statistics] (https://www.unido.org/en/resources/statistics/statistical-databases.html) will be instrumental in global monitoring of the progress of nations towards the achievement of industrialization.

 The World Statistics Day celebration will provide an excellent forum to commence a new task of industrial statistics in an atmosphere of cordiality, intellectual exercise and professional unity. Around 50 national and international statisticians have already confirmed their participation. Many of them will present their research papers covering the measurement issues on industrial growth, social inclusiveness and the impact of industrial production on environment.

posts.title: University of South Queensland to host two guest speakers on World Statistics Day
posts.text:
[The University of Southern Queensland (USQ)] (http://usq.edu.au) in Toowoomba will celebrate World Statistics Day 2015 by hosting Dr. Neil Gordon of the [Defence Science & Technology Group] (http://www.dsto.defence.gov.au) based in Adelaide and Dr. Ross Darnell, principal research scientist at the [Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation] (http://www.csiro.au), Brisbane. [Click here] (files/WSD_Australia.pdf) for the detailed program.

 Gordon, who was part of the Australian team to search for missing [Malaysian Airline] (http://www.malaysiaairlines.com) Flight MH370, will speak on “Bayesian Statistics and the Search for Flight MH370”. On 7 March 2014, MH370 carrying 239 passengers and crew from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing lost contact with air traffic control and was subsequently reported missing. In his talk, Gordon, a member of the [Australian Transport Safety Bureau] (http://www.atsb.gov.au) search advisory team, will show how Bayesian statistical estimation methods have been used to process the [Inmarsat] (http://www.inmarsat.com/) data and produce a probability distribution of MH370 flight paths that defines the current search zone in the southern Indian Ocean.

 Darnell will present a talk titled “Data Literacy in a World of Big Data”. There is an increasingly large amount of data available either publicly or available to scientists across the globe. Making honest predictions from these data is not necessarily determined by quantity. Even large datasets can be generated with limitations that define their quality. In his talk, Darnell will argue data scientists need to be trained to understand these limitations of empirical evidence.

 In the opening session, Professor Shahjahan Khan, the event organiser, will provide a brief introduction on “Why World Statistics Day?”

posts.title: The World’s Women 2015: Trends and Statistics will be launched on the World Statistics Day 2015
posts.text:
As part of the celebrations for the World Statistics Day 2015, the permanent missions of Japan and Mexico to the United Nations are joinly hosting a panel discussion for the launch of the publication “The World’s Women 2015: Trends and Statistics.”

This event will take place on Tuesday, 20 October 2015, from 11:30am-1:00pm, in Conference Room 6 at the UN Headquarters in New York.

The list of speakers in this event will include: 

- Opening by Ambassador, Permanent Representative of Japan to the United Nations

- Key findings from The World’s Women 2015, by Ms. Francesca Grum, Chief of the Social and Housing Statistics Section, United Nations Statistics Division

- Women and Universal Health Coverage in the Era of Global Ageing, by Ms. Reiko Hayashi, Director of the Department of International Research and Cooperation, National Institute of Population and Social Security Research (IPSS), Japan

- Measuring Violence against Women in Mexico, by Mr. Félix Vélez Fernández Varela, Vice President of INEGI Governing Board, Mexico.

The World’s Women 2015: Trends and Statistics is the sixth edition in a series of reports produced by the United Nations Statistics Division every five years as called for specifically in the Beijing Platform for Action adopted at the Fourth World Conference on Women in 1995.

The eight chapters of the report cover several critical areas of policy concerns identified in the 1995 Beijing Platform for Action: population and families; health; education; work; power and decision-making; violence against women; environment; and poverty. In each area, a life-cycle approach is used to reveal the experiences of women and men during different periods of life – from childhood and the formative years, through the working and reproductive stages, to older ages.

For additional information and RSVP by 16 October 2015 (required for non-UN pass holders), please contact [Ms. Harumi Shibata] (mailto:shibata@un.org).

posts.title: International Seminar on World Statistics Day 2015 in Peru will focus on ethnicity data

The seminar will take place in Lima on 20-21 October 2015.

Among other things, this indicator framework will require the collection of disaggregated data to ensure that no one is left behind, including ethnic and other vulnerable population groups.

posts.title: Hungary launches an extensive year-round programme in commemoration of World Statistics Day
posts.text:
Hungary, who was the main sponsor of the [General Assembly resolution] (https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B8n3WhOaTbGVQUlwMjJtcWtQZjQ/edit?pli=1), is embarking on a year-round celebration of statistics. [The Hungarian Central Statistical Office (HCO)] (http://www.ksh.hu) is creating a dedicated webpage on which they are going to report on the year-round series of events related to World Statistics Day. The page will also provide statistical curiosities, applications, games, online broadcasts and media contents for visitors.

##### A panel discussion in the HCSO under the motto  “Better data. Better lives”.

 Celebrations began on 18 September with a panel discussion in the Hungarian Central Statistical Office on “the practical use and value of statistical data”. The event was live broadcast through a link on the HCSO website.

##### “Doors open” days in the Hungarian Central Statistical Office 

 On 19-20 September 2015, in conjunction with the event series of the Cultural Heritage Days, the ‘Palace of Statistics’ once again opened its doors. The building located at 5-7 Keleti Károly Street is one of the few still used for the purpose for which it was designed. During the weekend, an exhibition of statistical curiosities, a games corner and a discounted book fair awaited visitors.

 [The HCSO library] (http://konyvtar.ksh.hu/index.php?s=fejlesztesalatt_en) also opened its doors. It has a collection of 850 thousand publications. Visitors had the chance to become familiar with the reading rooms, the movable bookshelves in the library’s compact storage area and the prestigious office of the director-general; they could browse old maps and publications once declared to be secret; furthermore, they could join the library for a discounted charge.

##### International conference celebrating World Statistics Day 2015

 The Hungarian Central Statistical Office, together with [the Hungarian Academy of Sciences] (http://www.mta.hu) and [the Hungarian Statistical Association] (http://isi.cbs.nl/statsoc/hungary2.htm), is organizing an international conference in Budapest on 20-21 October 2015. The topic is “Official statistics: New opportunities for transformation – innovation and cooperation”. 

 The conference aims to identify the main concerns and find answers to how producers of official statistics and institutions of higher education can respond in order to satisfy the rightful needs of our users on the short, medium and long term. Being aware of the complexity of the phenomenon, the conference will be addressed in a plenary session, followed by round-table discussions, which will be dedicated to five key aspects, namely:

* Sustainability of statistics: from data sources to the image of official statistics;
* Microdata exchange in international trade, migration and banking statistics;
* Human Resources Management and organisational modernisation;
* Training the new generations and rejuvenating the older generations of statisticians;
* Dissemination and communication. 
# 

 For a tentative programme [click here] (./files/20151002_HUN_Preliminary_Programme.pdf). The event will be live broadcast online to facilitate the sharing of knowledge and ideas as widely as possible. The recordings will be made available on Youtube.

##### Events at regional level 

 Connected to the events of World Statistics Day 2015, the Veszprém Department of the Hungarian Central Statistical Office, as well as the Chamber of Commerce of Veszprém County and the Europe Direct Information Centre of Veszprém County, will organise a team competition entitled 'Who knows more about the world of statistics?' for students studying in grades 10-13 of secondary schools in Veszprém county.

 The Hungarian Central Statistical Office is planning to continue organising further events related to World Statistics Day 2015 in the course of the following year.
